examples: Always keep a backup of the file.
The backup quarterback had to make up for the injured starter and lead the team to victory.
I'm hot on the heels of the suspect, requesting immediate backup.
Let's backup all our important files before we make any changes to the system - better safe than sorry.
You can set it so that it does an automatic data backup at the end of each day.
words.defineEn: the act of providing assistance or support to someone or something
words.defineVi: hành động cung cấp hỗ trợ hoặc hỗ trợ cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: There are gonna be slip-ups.

So whether our issue is over-eating or under-eating, or exercising, or binge and purging whatever it is, we're still gonna be around food and so there are gonna be slip-ups and the sooner you, as a loved one of them, can understand this and understand the process and that it's not perfect, the more helpful and the more loving and supportive you can be.
words.defineEn: a small mistake or error, usually unintentional
words.defineVi: một lỗi hoặc lỗi nhỏ, thường là vô ý

examples: The next big shake-up rolled in during the first half of the 20th century when behaviorism gained a higher profile.
For instance, some of the biggest shake-ups happen near boundaries in the landscape, like the edge of craters, where dramatic changes in elevation and temperature whip up super strong winds.
I'll conjure up some different types of severe weather to see how exactly shake-ups in the atmosphere can impact the biosphere and the geosphere.

It turns out that as dramatic as it was, the crack was just one of the latest symptoms of an ongoing seismic shake-up in Africa that’s eventually going rip the continent in two, leading to the creation of a brand-new ocean.
words.defineEn: a major reorganization or restructuring, especially of an organization or system
words.defineVi: một tổ chức lại hoặc tái cấu trúc lớn, đặc biệt là của một tổ chức hoặc hệ thống

examples: What is the holdup?
So, what's the holdup?
What is the holdup here?
Miles, what's the holdup?
Tell us, what's on the table and what are the holdups?
words.defineEn: a delay or interruption, often caused by an unexpected problem or obstacle
words.defineVi: một sự chậm trễ hoặc gián đoạn, thường gây ra bởi một vấn đề bất ngờ hoặc trở ngại

examples: A mixture of skill and good luck decided the outcome of the game.
The outcome of the game is in the team captain's hands.
The outcome of the court case will make or mar the future of the business.
The outcome of the election is now in the lap of the gods, as the polls are too close to call.
Whether you agree or not, it makes no odds to the outcome of the decision.
words.defineEn: the result or consequence of a situation, event, or action
words.defineVi: kết quả hoặc hậu quả của một tình huống, sự kiện, hoặc hành động

examples: The fashionable boots added a trendy touch to her outfit.
He prepares his outfit the night before to save time in the morning.

I check the weather forecast every morning to plan my outfit.
He wore a cowboy hat to complete his Western-themed outfit.
words.defineEn: a set of clothes that one wears together, especially for an event or occasion
words.defineVi: một bộ quần áo mà một người mặc cùng nhau, đặc biệt là cho một sự kiện hoặc dịp

examples: The manager keeps changing his outlook on the project, now really hopeful, now very pessimistic.
Although they had only just met, the two strangers found themselves talking for hours, realizing they were kindred spirits with a shared sense of humor and outlook on life.
They have different outlooks.
Your reaction to failure shapes your long-term outlook.
What's your outlook for that?
words.defineEn: a person's point of view or attitude toward life or a particular subject
words.defineVi: quan điểm hoặc thái độ của một người đối với cuộc sống hoặc một chủ đề cụ thể

examples: We need an outlet.

Having an outlet like exercise.
Mainstream news outlets like CNN and The New York Times are frequent targets of ire.
One of the outlets is unplugged!
words.defineEn: a store or organization where the products of a particular company are sold at a lower price
words.defineVi: một cửa hàng hoặc tổ chức nơi các sản phẩm của một công ty cụ thể được bán với giá thấp hơn

examples: She ordered a takeaway meal of pizza and garlic bread for dinner.

So anyways, here's the takeaway.

Ultimately the takeaway here Is that if you're looking for a therapist?
words.defineEn: a meal bought from a restaurant or store to be eaten somewhere else
words.defineVi: một bữa ăn mua từ một nhà hàng hoặc cửa hàng để ăn ở một nơi khác

examples: This takeover bid is bound to sound alarm bells at other tech companies.

Comment takeover ♪ - I'm glad.
words.defineEn: the acquisition of control or authority over a government or political system, often through force, coercion, or an election
words.defineVi: giành quyền kiểm soát hoặc quyền lực đối với chính phủ hoặc hệ thống chính trị, thường thông qua vũ lực, ép buộc hoặc bầu cử

examples: She downloaded a new movie to watch on her laptop during the flight.

The tech company developed a new app, confident that 'if you build it, they will come' and download it to use for their everyday needs.
words.defineEn: the act of copying and saving digital files, such as documents, music, or videos, from the internet onto a computer or other electronic device
words.defineVi: hành động sao chép và lưu các tệp kỹ thuật số, chẳng hạn như tài liệu, nhạc hoặc video, từ internet vào máy tính hoặc thiết bị điện tử khác

examples: He's sowing the seeds of his own downfall.
Investing more money on the project is like putting lipstick on a pig, might slow down our downfall but that's that.

And speaking of great downfalls!
But the company's aggressive expansion would also lead to its downfall.
words.defineEn: the cause or source of a person's ruin or failure
words.defineVi: nguyên nhân hoặc nguồn gốc của sự hủy hoại hoặc thất bại của một người

examples: Southern Louisiana braced today for more downpours and more flooding this week.
Webspinners can easily drown if a downpour floods their gallery.

Except now it's sunny, but like, literally fifteen minutes ago, there was a downpour.
words.defineEn: a brief heavy rainfall
words.defineVi: một lượng mưa lớn ngắn

examples: Scientists believe that a major breakthrough is on the horizon.
You're just chasing your tail at this point, but you might have a breakthrough with the research if you take a break from it.
By this time next year, they will still be living on borrowed time unless a breakthrough is made in medical research.
The scientist's experiments failed many times before she finally achieved her breakthrough, but she kept trying with the belief that if at first you do not succeed, try, try again.
Two of these people will make a breakthrough.
words.defineEn: an important discovery or development that helps improve a situation or answer a problem
words.defineVi: một khám phá hoặc phát triển quan trọng giúp cải thiện tình hình hoặc giải đáp một vấn đề

examples: The engineers have been putting a brave face on the problem, but I think this breakdown is going to set us back for months.

words.defineVi: thất bại trong tiến trình hoặc hiệu quả của một mối quan hệ hoặc hệ thống

examples: She hardened her heart against him after their breakup.

I think her recent breakup is playing a part in her moodiness.

words.defineVi: sự kết thúc của một mối quan hệ hoặc một hiệp hội

examples: It's just a minor setback.

Success often requires us to bear and forbear through various challenges and setbacks.
The successful businessman understood the importance of the saying 'the early man never borrows from the late man', and always started his projects early to avoid delays and setbacks.
words.defineEn: a problem that gets in the way of a process or makes it worse
words.defineVi: một vấn đề cản trở một quá trình hoặc làm cho nó tồi tệ hơn

examples: The showdown is over.

And as the auto industry has continued to bleed more and more into the tech space, it's had an increasingly large presence at the gadget showdown.
[as] he heads for California and the showdown that really counts At San Diego's center for brain studies.
words.defineEn: a fight, test, or argument that will resolve a prolonged disagreement
words.defineVi: một cuộc chiến, kiểm tra hoặc tranh luận sẽ giải quyết một sự bất đồng kéo dài

examples: It was clear from her outburst that she was at the end of her rope.

Sometimes this can look like outburst of laughing for seemingly no reason.
These features have all been seen across other pulsar outbursts, but J1808 put them all together.
words.defineEn: a sudden, violent expression of strong emotion, typically anger or excitement
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện đột ngột, dữ dội của cảm xúc mạnh mẽ, điển hình là sự tức giận hoặc phấn khích

examples: Every mutual fund has an upkeep fee called an ANNUAL EXPENSE RATIO, which ranges from around 0.1% to 2% of the value per year.
That's just gonna be a lot of upkeep.
The biggest source of income within this category is the passenger facility charge, that goes to the upkeep and maintenance of the airport.
Between the weight of the ice pressing down on every ceiling, the heat generated by both buildings and humans, and the movement of the ice itself, the whole base required constant upkeep.
Djenne’s traditional mud brick architecture requires constant upkeep and re-plastering, with every rainy season washing away plaster and eroding the brick.
words.defineEn: the act of maintaining something in good condition
words.defineVi: hành động duy trì một cái gì đó trong tình trạng tốt

examples: There has been a slight upturn in the economy, but we’re not out of the woods yet.
Manuals about birth control methods continued the trend of bringing down the birthrate, although there was a brief upturn just after the war.
Even if an upturn were to begin in 2022, Moody's base case projection doesn't see state tax revenues returning to 2019 levels until 2024.

But most economists say they believe an upturn is on the way, as inoculations ramp up in coming weeks.
words.defineEn: an improvement or a positive change in a situation, especially in the economy or business
words.defineVi: một sự cải thiện hoặc thay đổi tích cực trong một tình huống, đặc biệt là trong nền kinh tế hoặc kinh doanh

examples: Keep a sharp lookout for David.

examples: We did a water cooled rig, including repairing a pin on a CPU that was otherwise completely a write-off.

examples: Their city housed an offshoot of the Bodhi tree under which Buddha himself was said to have attained enlightenment.

words.defineEn: a new development that grows out of an existing situation, concept, or organization, typically as a natural progression or consequence
words.defineVi: một sự phát triển mới phát triển từ một tình huống, khái niệm hoặc tổ chức hiện có, thường là một sự tiến triển hoặc hệ quả tự nhiên

examples: The author was able to make a comeback after a series of poorly received books, with a new novel that became a bestseller and earned critical praise.

words.defineEn: a quick or witty response to a comment or insult, often intended to show wit or intelligence
words.defineVi: một phản ứng nhanh chóng hoặc dí dỏm đối với một bình luận hoặc xúc phạm, thường nhằm thể hiện trí thông minh hoặc trí thông minh

examples: As Asmus shows, even the German government remained in two minds as to the benefits of no longer being on the frontline and the drawbacks of alienating Russia.

They have some drawbacks, of course.
